headline: The S&P 500 Entered a Correction Last Week. 3 Stocks Down 20% or More to Buy on the Dip.
summary: A stock market correction refers to a 10% to 20% pullback from a peak.  During stock market volatility like corrections, shares of quality companies often go on sale, even if the market doesn't stay in the correction zone.  This provides investors with better-than-normal chances to buy shares of quality companies at more attractive prices.
